Method Detail

getVerticalFlowLayout

public static final VerticalFlowLayout getVerticalFlowLayout()
getVerticalFlowLayout returns a VerticalFlowLayout manager with center alignment and 5 pixel gaps on the vertical & horizontal spacing between components.
Returns:
an instance of the jjb.toolbox.awt.VerticalFlowLayout manager.

getVerticalFlowLayout

public static final VerticalFlowLayout getVerticalFlowLayout(int align)
getVerticalFlowLayout returns a VerticalFlowLayoutManager with the specified alignment and 5 pixel gaps on the vertical & horizontal spacing between components.
Parameters:
align - is an integer value specifying the alignment of components within their defined space (CENTER, LEFT, RIGHT).
Returns:
an instance of the jjb.toolbox.awt.VerticalFlowLayout manager.

getVerticalFlowLayout

public static final VerticalFlowLayout getVerticalFlowLayout(int align,
                                                             int horizontalGap,
                                                             int verticalGap)
getVerticalFlowLayout returns a VerticalFlowLayoutManager with the specified alignment, horizontalGap, and VerticalGap betweeen components in the panel with the VerticalFlowLayout.
Parameters:
align - is an integer value specifying the alignment of components within their defined space (CENTER, LEFT, RIGHT).
horizontalGap - is an int value specifying the number of pixels between components horizontally.
verticalGap - is an int value specifying the number of pixels between components vertically.
Returns:
an instance of the jjb.toolbox.awt.VerticalFlowLayout manager.

setConstraints

public static final void setConstraints(java.awt.GridBagConstraints gbc,
                                        int gridx,
                                        int gridy)
setConstraints are used to set the properties of the GridBagConstraints object used in determining the layout of components in a container object.
Parameters:
gbc - is a Ljvaa.awt.GridBagConstraints variable containing layout constraints.
gridx - is an integer value indicating the cell at the left of the component's display area, where the leftmost cell has gridx=0.
gridy - is an integer value indicating the cell at the top of the component's display area, where the topmost cell has gridy=0.

_setConstraints

public static final void _setConstraints(java.awt.GridBagConstraints gbc,
                                         int gridx,
                                         int gridy,
                                         int fill,
                                         int anchor)
setConstraints are used to set the properties of the GridBagConstraints object used in determining the layout of components in a container object.
Parameters:
gbc - is a Ljvaa.awt.GridBagConstraints variable containing layout constraints.
gridx - is an integer value indicating the cell at the left of the component's display area, where the leftmost cell has gridx=0.
gridy - is an integer value indicating the cell at the top of the component's display area, where the topmost cell has gridy=0.
fill - is an integer field is used when the component's display area is larger than the component's requested size.
anchor - is used to determine which part of the cell the component should be placed. The field is used when the component is smaller than its display area. Possible values include: CENTER, NORTH, NORTHEAST, EAST, SOUTHEAST, SOUTH, SOUTHWEST, WEST and NORTHWEST.

                                        int gridWidth,
                                        int gridHeight)
setConstraints are used to set the properties of the GridBagConstraints object used in determining the layout of components in a container object.

gbc - is a Ljvaa.awt.GridBagConstraints variable containing layout constraints.
gridx - is an integer value indicating the cell at the left of the component's display area, where the leftmost cell has gridx=0.
gridy - is an integer value indicating the cell at the top of the component's display area, where the topmost cell has gridy=0.
gridWidth - is an integer value specifying the number of cells in a row for the component's display area.
gridHeight - is an integer value specifying the number of cells in a column for the component's display area.

                                        int gridx,
                                        int gridy,
                                        int gridWidth,
                                        int gridHeight,
                                        int weightX,
                                        int weightY)
setConstraints are used to set the properties of the GridBagConstraints object used in determining the layout of components in a container object.
Parameters:
gbc - is a Ljvaa.awt.GridBagConstraints variable containing layout constraints.
gridx - is an integer value indicating the cell at the left of the component's display area, where the leftmost cell has gridx=0.
gridy - is an integer value indicating the cell at the top of the component's display area, where the topmost cell has gridy=0.
gridWidth - is an integer value specifying the number of cells in a row for the component's display area.
gridHeight - is an integer value specifying the number of cells in a column for the component's display area.
weightX - is an integer value specifying how to distribute extra horizontal space.
weightY - is an integer value specifying how to distribute extra vertical space.

                                        int gridHeight,
                                        int weightX,
                                        int weightY,
                                        int fill,
                                        int anchor,
                                        java.awt.Insets insets)
setConstraints are used to set the properties of the GridBagConstraints object used in determining the layout of components in a container object.
Parameters:
gbc - is a Ljvaa.awt.GridBagConstraints variable containing layout constraints.
gridx - is an integer value indicating the cell at the left of the component's display area, where the leftmost cell has gridx=0.
gridy - is an integer value indicating the cell at the top of the component's display area, where the topmost cell has gridy=0.
gridWidth - is an integer value specifying the number of cells in a row for the component's display area.
gridHeight - is an integer value specifying the number of cells in a column for the component's display area.
weightX - is an integer value specifying how to distribute extra horizontal space.
weightY - is an integer value specifying how to distribute extra vertical space.
fill - is an integer field is used when the component's display area is larger than the component's requested size.
anchor - is used to determine which part of the cell the component should be placed. The field is used when the component is smaller than its display area. Possible values include: CENTER, NORTH, NORTHEAST, EAST, SOUTHEAST, SOUTH, SOUTHWEST, WEST and NORTHWEST.
insets - is a Ljava.awt.Insets object field specifiing the external padding of the component, the minimum amount of space between the component and the edges of its display area.

setConstraints

public static final void setConstraints(java.awt.GridBagConstraints gbc,
                                        int gridx,
                                        int gridy,
                                        int gridWidth,
                                        int gridHeight,
                                        int weightX,
                                        int weightY,
                                        int fill,
                                        int anchor,
                                        java.awt.Insets insets,
                                        int ipadx,
                                        int ipady)
setConstraints are used to set the properties of the GridBagConstraints object used in determining the layout of components in a container object.
Parameters:
gbc - is a Ljvaa.awt.GridBagConstraints variable containing layout constraints.
gridx - is an integer value indicating the cell at the left of the component's display area, where the leftmost cell has gridx=0.
gridy - is an integer value indicating the cell at the top of the component's display area, where the topmost cell has gridy=0.
gridWidth - is an integer value specifying the number of cells in a row for the component's display area.
gridHeight - is an integer value specifying the number of cells in a column for the component's display area.
weightX - is an integer value specifying how to distribute extra horizontal space.
weightY - is an integer value specifying how to distribute extra vertical space.
fill - is an integer field is used when the component's display area is larger than the component's requested size.
anchor - is used to determine which part of the cell the component should be placed. The field is used when the component is smaller than its display area. Possible values include: CENTER, NORTH, NORTHEAST, EAST, SOUTHEAST, SOUTH, SOUTHWEST, WEST and NORTHWEST.
insets - is a Ljava.awt.Insets object field specifiing the external padding of the component, the minimum amount of space between the component and the edges of its display area.
ipadx - is an integer value field specifying the internal padding of the component, how much space to add to the minimum width of the component.
ipady - is an integer value This field specifying the internal padding, that is, how much space to add to the minimum height of the component.
